trans-unit.source: Create Cloud Service
trans-unit.target: Create Cloud Service

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Create Cloud Service</languageKeyword> asynchronous operation creates a new cloud service in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Create Cloud Service</languageKeyword> asynchronous operation creates a new cloud service in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: For more information about cloud services and how you can use them, see <externalLink><linkText>What is a cloud service?</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/manage/services/cloud-services/what-is-a-cloud-service/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about cloud services and how you can use them, see <externalLink><linkText>What is a cloud service?</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/manage/services/cloud-services/what-is-a-cloud-service/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Before you can run this operation, you must create a subscription and obtain the subscription identifier.
trans-unit.target: Before you can run this operation, you must create a subscription and obtain the subscription identifier.

trans-unit.source: For more information about creating an Azure subscription, see <externalLink><linkText>Welcome to Microsoft Azure</linkText><linkUri>https://account.windowsazure.com/Home/Index</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about creating an Azure subscription, see <externalLink><linkText>Welcome to Microsoft Azure</linkText><linkUri>https://account.windowsazure.com/Home/Index</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain the subscription identifier on the Settings page of the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain the subscription identifier on the Settings page of the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Create and upload a management certificate to authorize the operation.
trans-unit.target: Create and upload a management certificate to authorize the operation.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Create and Upload a Management Certificate for Microsoft Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg551722.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Create and Upload a Management Certificate for Microsoft Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg551722.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Create Cloud Service</languageKeyword> request is specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Create Cloud Service</languageKeyword> request is specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: POST
trans-unit.target: POST

trans-unit.source: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.
trans-unit.target: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.

trans-unit.source: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.

trans-unit.source: URI Parameters
trans-unit.target: URI Parameters

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Set this header to <userInput>application/xml</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Set this header to <userInput>application/xml</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: The value of this header must be set to <userInput>2010-10-28</userInput> or higher.
trans-unit.target: The value of this header must be set to <userInput>2010-10-28</userInput> or higher.

trans-unit.source: For more information about versioning headers, see <link xlink:href="bb009293-529c-4793-b925-0f8701f337d2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Versioning</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about versioning headers, see <link xlink:href="bb009293-529c-4793-b925-0f8701f337d2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Versioning</link>.

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: The format of the request body is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The format of the request body is as follows:

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the elements of the request body.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the elements of the request body.

trans-unit.source: Element Name
trans-unit.target: Element Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: ServiceName
trans-unit.target: ServiceName

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name for the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name for the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: This name must be unique within Azure.
trans-unit.target: This name must be unique within Azure.

trans-unit.source: This name is the DNS prefix name that is used to access the service.
trans-unit.target: This name is the DNS prefix name that is used to access the service.

trans-unit.source: To verify the availability of a name, you can use <externalLink><linkText>Check Cloud Service Name Availability</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj154116.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: To verify the availability of a name, you can use <externalLink><linkText>Check Cloud Service Name Availability</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj154116.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Label
trans-unit.target: Label

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the base-64-encoded identifier of the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the base-64-encoded identifier of the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: The identifier can be up to 100 characters long.
trans-unit.target: The identifier can be up to 100 characters long.

trans-unit.source: The label can be used for your tracking purposes.
trans-unit.target: The label can be used for your tracking purposes.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the description of the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the description of the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: The description can be up to 1024 characters long.
trans-unit.target: The description can be up to 1024 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Location
trans-unit.target: Location

trans-unit.source: Required if <languageKeyword>AffinityGroup</languageKeyword> is not specified.
trans-unit.target: Required if <languageKeyword>AffinityGroup</languageKeyword> is not specified.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the location where the cloud service is created.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the location where the cloud service is created.

trans-unit.source: You must specify <languageKeyword>Location</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>AffinityGroup</languageKeyword>, but not both.
trans-unit.target: You must specify <languageKeyword>Location</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>AffinityGroup</languageKeyword>, but not both.

trans-unit.source: To see the available locations, you can use <link xlink:href="954b5c9f-e9ae-434f-8c13-11cd74c5d1a1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Locations</link>.
trans-unit.target: To see the available locations, you can use <link xlink:href="954b5c9f-e9ae-434f-8c13-11cd74c5d1a1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Locations</link>.

trans-unit.source: AffinityGroup
trans-unit.target: AffinityGroup

trans-unit.source: Required if <languageKeyword>Location</languageKeyword> is not specified.
trans-unit.target: Required if <languageKeyword>Location</languageKeyword> is not specified.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of an existing affinity group that is associated with the subscription.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of an existing affinity group that is associated with the subscription.

trans-unit.source: You must specify <languageKeyword>Location</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>AffinityGroup</languageKeyword>, but not both.
trans-unit.target: You must specify <languageKeyword>Location</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>AffinityGroup</languageKeyword>, but not both.

trans-unit.source: To see the available affinity groups, you can use <legacyLink xlink:href="e2af3475-b0d0-407c-8252-6af8d1e22215" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Affinity Groups</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: To see the available affinity groups, you can use <legacyLink xlink:href="e2af3475-b0d0-407c-8252-6af8d1e22215" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Affinity Groups</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of an extended cloud service property.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of an extended cloud service property.

trans-unit.source: The name can be up to 64 characters long, only alphanumeric characters and underscores are valid in the name, and it must start with a letter.
trans-unit.target: The name can be up to 64 characters long, only alphanumeric characters and underscores are valid in the name, and it must start with a letter.

trans-unit.source: Each extended property must have both a defined name and value.
trans-unit.target: Each extended property must have both a defined name and value.

trans-unit.source: You can define a maximum of 50 extended properties.
trans-unit.target: You can define a maximum of 50 extended properties.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Name</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Name</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the value of an extended cloud service property.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the value of an extended cloud service property.

trans-unit.source: The extended property value can be up to 255 characters long.
trans-unit.target: The extended property value can be up to 255 characters long.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Value</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Value</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: ReverseDnsFqdn
trans-unit.target: ReverseDnsFqdn

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the DNS address to which the IP address of the cloud service resolves when queried using a reverse DNS query.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the DNS address to which the IP address of the cloud service resolves when queried using a reverse DNS query.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>ReverseDnsFqdn</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-06-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>ReverseDnsFqdn</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-06-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code and a set of response headers.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 201 (Created).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 201 (Created).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Response Headers
trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Response Header
trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.
trans-unit.target: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.

trans-unit.source: For an asynchronous operation, you can call <link xlink:href="1215ece5-cbef-4a85-a3db-ab6c20c2c6df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Operation Status</link> with the value of the header to determine whether the operation is complete, has failed, or is still in progress.
trans-unit.target: For an asynchronous operation, you can call <link xlink:href="1215ece5-cbef-4a85-a3db-ab6c20c2c6df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Operation Status</link> with the value of the header to determine whether the operation is complete, has failed, or is still in progress.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: You can also use the following resources to create a new cloud service:
trans-unit.target: You can also use the following resources to create a new cloud service:

trans-unit.source: How to Create and Deploy a Cloud Service
trans-unit.target: How to Create and Deploy a Cloud Service

trans-unit.source: Create a Microsoft Azure service
trans-unit.target: Create a Microsoft Azure service

trans-unit.source: After you create a cloud service, the next step is to create a deployment.
trans-unit.target: After you create a cloud service, the next step is to create a deployment.

trans-unit.source: For more information see the following:
trans-unit.target: For more information see the following:

trans-unit.source: Create Deployment
trans-unit.target: Create Deployment

trans-unit.source: Create Virtual Machine Deployment
trans-unit.target: Create Virtual Machine Deployment

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: The following console application example shows you how to create a new cloud service.
trans-unit.target: The following console application example shows you how to create a new cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Replace the following variable values:
trans-unit.target: Replace the following variable values:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Thumbprint</embeddedLabel> – with the thumbprint of a management certificate in your subscription
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Thumbprint</embeddedLabel> – with the thumbprint of a management certificate in your subscription

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>SubscriptionId</embeddedLabel> – with the subscription identifier that you obtained from the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>SubscriptionId</embeddedLabel> – with the subscription identifier that you obtained from the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>ServiceName</embeddedLabel> – with the name that you want to use for the new cloud service
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>ServiceName</embeddedLabel> – with the name that you want to use for the new cloud service

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> – with the geo-location where you would like to locate the cloud service
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> – with the geo-location where you would like to locate the cloud service

trans-unit.source: You can use <externalLink><linkText>List Locations</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg441293.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> to obtain the appropriate location.
trans-unit.target: You can use <externalLink><linkText>List Locations</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg441293.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> to obtain the appropriate location.
